com.datastax.driver.mapping

Class DefaultHierarchyScanStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datastax.driver.mapping.DefaultHierarchyScanStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HierarchyScanStrategy

    public class DefaultHierarchyScanStrategy
extends Object
implements HierarchyScanStrategy
    The default HierarchyScanStrategy.

    This strategy assumes that there exists a common ancestor for all mapped classes in the application, and allows all its descendants (optionally including itself) to be scanned for annotations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultHierarchyScanStrategy()
      Creates a new instance with defaults: the common ancestor is Object excluded, which implies that every ancestor of a mapped class, except Object itself, will be scanned for annotations.
      DefaultHierarchyScanStrategy(Class<?> highestAncestor, boolean included)
      Creates a new instance with the given highest common ancestor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      List<Class<?>> filterClassHierarchy(Class<?> mappedClass)
      Computes the ancestors of the given base class, optionally filtering out any ancestor that should not be scanned.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultHierarchyScanStrategy

        public DefaultHierarchyScanStrategy()
        Creates a new instance with defaults: the common ancestor is Object excluded, which implies that every ancestor of a mapped class, except Object itself, will be scanned for annotations.

      • DefaultHierarchyScanStrategy

        public DefaultHierarchyScanStrategy(Class<?> highestAncestor,
                                    boolean included)
        Creates a new instance with the given highest common ancestor.
        Parameters:
        highestAncestor - The highest ancestor class to consider; cannot be null.
        included - Whether or not to include the highest ancestor itself.

    • Method Detail

      • filterClassHierarchy

        public List<Class<?>> filterClassHierarchy(Class<?> mappedClass)
        Description copied from interface: HierarchyScanStrategy
        Computes the ancestors of the given base class, optionally filtering out any ancestor that should not be scanned.

        Implementors should always include mappedClass in the returned list.

        Specified by:
        filterClassHierarchy in interface HierarchyScanStrategy
        Parameters:
        mappedClass - The mapped class; this is necessarily a class annotated with either @Table or @UDT.
        Returns:
        the list of classes that should be scanned, including mappedClass itself and its ancestors, ordered from the lowest (closest to mappedClass) to the highest (or farthest from mappedClass).
